note.p: Birth: Righton, East Riding, Yorkshire, England (02 March 1811)
Death: On a railway line between Retford and Gainsborough, Lincolnshire (13 or 14 September 1853)

Career: Deputy Reader in Geology, University of Oxford; knocked down and killed instantly by an oncoming express train while examining a new railway cutting of the Sheffield, Manchester and Lincolnshire Railway.
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1850-1854 vol 6 p 359
Notes: DNB gives death date as 13 September 1853; Boase gives 14 September 1853.
